question: In which system of economy is the “participation of the workers in the collective bargaining” is a feature?
explanation: The socialist model of the economy is based on the Marx Model of communism where the state owns the factors of production. The capital cannot be privately held and there is communal ownership or what is known as “Communism”. The workers are paid uniform wages and what Marx called the “participation of the workers in the collective bargaining” is a feature of the system.
